intro: Graffenrieda patens, commonly known as the velvetleaf or Mexican bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its dark green, velvety foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Graffenrieda patens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
